messages.content: Which year marks the founding of Elsevier?
What is the main concept discussed in the paper by Jianggang Zhu, Zheng Wang, Jingjing Chen, Yi-Ping Phoebe Chen, and Yu-Gang Jiang?
Balanced contrastive learning for long-tailed visual recognition
What makes a publication by Springer credible?
Springer's publications are considered credible due to their rigorous review process.

ICML.

Lei Han, Tian Zheng, Lan Xu, and Lu Fang

IWANN 2021

How many total pages were there in the Proceedings of the IEEE conference on computer vision and pattern recognition where Weiyue Wang et al. presented their paper?
What classes show significant improvement when the IC module is applied in Phase 2 of Split-A?
recycling bin and trash bin
What classes are observed only once and show improvement when the IC module is applied in Phase 3 of Split-A?
piano, bucket, and laundry basket

Springer has grown and expanded its publishing reach.

Establishment of Elsevier

Springer is known for its quality and diversity of publications.

Zhihao Liang, Zhihao Li, Songcen Xu, Mingkui Tan, and Kui Jia

Ziwei Liu, Zhongqi Miao, Xiaohang Zhan, Jiayun Wang, Boqing Gong, and Stella X Yu
How many pages does the research paper on under-represented data in face recognition have?
What kind of annotations are associated with the 3d reconstructions discussed by Dai, Chang, Savva, Halber, Funkhouser, and Nießner?
Richly-annotated annotations.
What is the main focus of the proposed CLIMB-3D framework in the context of continual 3D scene understanding?
CLIMB-3D aims to balance between stability and plasticity to advance continual 3D scene understanding.
When did Elsevier come into existence?
In what year did the events in the context take place?
What is the title of the paper?
Pointcontrast: Unsupervised pre-training for 3d point cloud understanding
Which dataset is used to evaluate the proposed method in the CLIMB-3D paper for 3D instance segmentation?
The method is evaluated on the ScanNet200 dataset.
What type of data is the paper 'Feature space augmentation for long-tailed data' focusing on?
long-tailed data
Who are the authors of the paper 'icarl: Incremental classifier and representation learning'?
Sylvestre-Alvise Rebuffi, Alexander Kolesnikov, Georg Sperl, and Christoph H Lampert.
Who is the first author of the paper?
Li Shen
Which module compensates for the low performance on rare classes like shower and toaster?
IC module
What type of loss is discussed in the paper?
Class-balanced loss based on effective number of samples.
What is the title of the paper by Weiyue Wang et al.?
Sgpn: Similarity group proposal network for 3d point cloud instance segmentation

Bilateral-branch network with cumulative learning for long-tailed visual recognition
How many pages is the paper?
Which publisher released the book in the given context?
Springer
What is the status of the copyright for this document?
Owned by the authors
What kind of audience is likely to be interested in books published by Springer?
Academics, researchers, and scholars
Why is the Exemplar Replay (ER) component alone insufficient for robust performance in CLIMB-3D?
ER alone is insufficient due to strict memory constraints required in class-incremental 3D instance segmentation.
Who are the authors of the paper 'Per-pixel classification is not all you need for semantic segmentation'?
Bowen Cheng, Alex Schwing, and Alexander Kirillov.
In which year was the paper 'Self supervision to distillation for long-tailed visual recognition' presented?

How many authors contributed to the paper by Zifeng Wang et al.?

Virtual Event

Salman Khan, Munawar Hayat, Syed Waqas Zamir, Jianbing Shen, and Ling Shao
What issue does the paper 'Overcoming catastrophic forgetting with hard attention to the task' address?
Catastrophic forgetting.
What is the title of the publication where the research on feature transfer learning for face recognition was presented?
CVPR
What type of scenes are reconstructed in the paper 'Scannet: Richly-annotated 3d reconstructions of indoor scenes'?
Indoor scenes.
In which conference was the paper titled 'Co2l: Contrastive continual learning' presented?
ICCV

CVPR

Deep convolutional neural networks

Richly-annotated 3d reconstructions of indoor scenes.

Effective learning of deep convolutional neural networks using Relay backpropagation
What key metrics are used to evaluate the proposed CLIMB-3D method?
mAP (Mean Average Precision) and FPP (Forgetting Percentage Points) are key metrics.
How many tasks are in each of the scenarios Split-A, Split-B, and Split-C?
Three tasks: Task 1, Task 2, and Task 3
How does Springer stay relevant in the ever-changing academic landscape?
Springer adapts to new trends and technologies to remain relevant.
What is the page range of the paper within the conference proceedings?
What issue does the baseline method face according to the results presented in Split-B?
The baseline method incorrectly identifies the same sofa as separate instances
What is the primary focus of the research paper CLIMB-3D1?
The research paper focuses on CLass-Incremental Imbalanced 3D Instance Segmentation.
What is the proposed framework in the CLIMB-3D paper to address class imbalance in 3D instance segmentation?
The proposed framework is CLIMB-3D, a unified framework for Class-Incremental Imbalance-aware 3D Instance Segmentation.
What is the focus of the paper presented by Dai et al. at CVPR in 2017?
Richly-annotated 3d reconstructions of indoor scenes.
Who are the authors of the paper 'Dark experience for general continual learning: a strong, simple baseline'?
Pietro Buzzega, Matteo Boschini, Angelo Porrello, Davide Abati, and Simone Calderara.

Shuang Li, Kaixiong Gong, Chi Harold Liu, Yulin Wang, Feng Qiao, and Xinjing Cheng

ScanNet200 dataset

Proceedings of Machine Learning Research
How many pages does the paper by Zifeng Wang et al. span?

CVPR
What is the focus of the CLIMB-3D research project?
Class-Incremental Imbalanced 3D Instance Segmentation

What year does the publication refer to?
Which conference did the paper appear in?
ECCV
Where was the paper presented?
In CVPR.
What is the role of Exemplar Replay (ER) in the CLIMB-3D framework?
ER mitigates forgetting by storing representative samples from earlier phases.
Which company was established in 1989 according to the context provided?
Elsevier
What overall performance improvement does the proposed method achieve compared to the baseline?
The proposed method improves mAP by 5.6% compared to the baseline.
What strategy do the authors suggest using to prevent catastrophic forgetting?
Hard attention to the task.
Can anyone else claim the copyright of this document?
No
In which scenarios are the instances of classes encountered in random order?
Split-C
What does the mIoU metric quantify in the context of 3D semantic segmentation?
mIoU measures the overlap between predicted and ground truth segments.
What results are presented in Appendix D of the supplementary material?
Detailed split information for all scenarios based on class names is provided in Appendix D.
What issue does the class-balanced re-weighting (CBR) scheme in CLIMB-3D aim to address?
The CBR scheme aims to address the bias towards frequent classes in the pseudo-label generator (PLG).

The majority can help the minority: Context-rich minority oversampling for long-tailed classification.

Academic or scientific material

Relay backpropagation for effective learning of deep convolutional neural networks

To overcome catastrophic forgetting.
What is the title of the paper mentioned?
Class-balanced loss based on effective number of samples.
How do the authors propose to overcome catastrophic forgetting in their paper?
With hard attention to the task.

How is the IC module designed to address performance gaps for rare classes?
The IC module is designed to address performance gaps for rare classes.

Unsupervised pre-training for 3d point cloud understanding

NeurIPS.

PLG generates supervision signals for previously seen classes using a frozen model.

ECCV

Lifelong learning

Jun Shu, Qi Xie, Lixuan Yi, Qian Zhao, Sanping Zhou, Zongben Xu, and Deyu Meng.

PLG extends supervision to previously learned categories by leveraging predictions from a frozen model trained on prior tasks.

NeurIPS

High-quality
In what way does the CLIMB-3D method demonstrate strong generalization across classes in both instance and semantic segmentation tasks?
The method demonstrates strong generalization by achieving approximately 30% mIoU improvement for semantic segmentation and surpassing prior work in instance segmentation.

Lifelong learning

The model achieves 43.13% mAP50 in Phase 2 compared to 24.53% on the baseline.

The proposed method is compared to ER and KD in improving performance for rare classes.

IC module

Most existing methods assume that all object classes are known in advance and uniformly distributed.
